title: How do trust relationships work across accounts?
About AWS Organizations and AWS Control Tower
excerpt: AWS Organizations enables centralized management of multiple AWS accounts with policy-based governance, while AWS Control Tower provides a pre-packaged solution for establishing secure multi-account environments with automated guardrails and compliance controls.

title: How do push notifications work?
excerpt: Push notifications work through a system involving servers, operating systems, and apps that enables messages to be delivered to devices even when the target app isn't actively running.

title: What is Model Context Protocol (MCP)
excerpt: MCP is an open-source standard to connect LLMs to external tools, such as databases or APIs. It's built on JSON-RPC 2.0, supports stateful sessions, and centers around three main roles: Host, Client, and Server.

title: About CloudFormation
excerpt: AWS CloudFormation is a powerful Infrastructure as Code (IaC) service that allows you to model and provision AWS resources using declarative templates.

title: About vector databases
excerpt: Vector databases represent data as mathematical vector embeddings. A vector embedding is represented by an array of numbers. These vectors capture the semantic essence of the data.

title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
excerpt: An explanation of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) - how AI systems can access external knowledge sources to provide more accurate and up-to-date answers, including the difference between basic RAG and agentic RAG with practical code examples.

title: AI Agents and the Evolution of Software: Insights from IBM and Andrej Karpathy
excerpt: I recently watched two excellent videos that provide deep insights into the current state and future of AI agents and how they're fundamentally changing software development. Let me share my thoughts on these presentations.

title: Artificial Intelligence Timeline: 2020 - 2025
excerpt: Let's start with a brief summary of AI development over the last few years.
